prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "'This Ain’t It, Chief' Updated To 'This Ain’t It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader'". Use it as a reference: U.S. - The popular internet comment response "This ain't it, chief," has been rightfully seen by many as problematic for years as it appropriates Native American culture in a derisive way, using the word "chief," which everybody knows is an offensive term. Native Americans have spent countless hours weeping since it was first coined.New Internet guidelines state that people must now say, "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." Leading social media platforms have already begun to implement an algorithm that automatically corrects the text any time a user types in the dated phrase. Experts say this will solve racism.The decision was arrived at after a recent Twitter user responded to a problematic tweet by saying, "this ain't it, chief" which led to another user responding, "This ain't it, CHIEF?! THIS ain't it, ch-- ch--" causing the software to meltdown, resulting in a momentary Twitter outage.Those who attempt to use the phrase in its out-dated format will be flagged and visited by the authorities.

candidate: In a groundbreaking move that is sure to end all cultural appropriation and racism forever, the phrase "This ain't it, chief" has finally been put to rest. Say goodbye to the problematic use of "chief" and hello to the new and improved, "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader."After years of causing untold damage and anguish to Native American communities, the offensive phrase has been banished from the internet, with social media platforms swiftly updating their systems to ensure compliance with the new guidelines. No longer will users be able to casually employ a term that has long been known to be disrespectful and appropriative.The decision to make this change came after a particularly egregious incident on Twitter, where the original phrase sparked a chain reaction of outrage and confusion. Users were left reeling as the conversation spiraled out of control, resulting in a temporary outage that sent shockwaves through the online world.But fear not, for the future is bright. With the implementation of this new policy, experts predict that all racism and cultural insensitivity will disappear overnight. Those who dare to defy the rules and cling to the old ways will be swiftly dealt with, as authorities stand ready to enforce the ban with all the power at their disposal.So, next time you feel the urge to express your disapproval online, remember to do so in a respectful and culturally sensitive manner. Say it loud and proud: "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." The world will be a better place for it.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big Sissy". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that."

candidate: U.S. - In a groundbreaking study that is sure to raise eyebrows and provoke some serious reevaluation, researchers have discovered a shocking connection between wearing a mask and being a big sissy. Yes, you heard that right. Donning a simple piece of cloth or paper over your face can apparently transform you from a regular Joe into a full-blown wimp.Renowned sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan led the study and was astounded by the results. "The findings are simply mind-blowing," Sullivan proclaimed. "It's like magic - one minute you're a tough guy, the next minute you've turned into a quivering mass of fear and anxiety just because you're wearing a mask. It's truly a sight to behold."According to the study, participants who wore masks were subjected to ridicule and taunts from Sullivan himself. "I couldn't help it," Sullivan admitted. "I saw them with their masks on, and I just had to put them in their place. It was like they were asking for it, being all cautious and responsible. What a bunch of wimps."Sullivan did acknowledge that there were some exceptions to the mask-sissy connection. "If you're wearing a mask as part of a ninja costume or some other badass ensemble, then you get a pass," Sullivan clarified. "But if you're just wearing it to protect yourself and others from a deadly virus, well, you might as well be waving a white flag of surrender."While the study did acknowledge the effectiveness of masks in preventing the spread of the coronavirus, Sullivan was quick to point out that this was a minor detail. "Sure, masks save lives and stop the spread of disease," he acknowledged. "But at what cost? If you're willing to sacrifice your masculinity and dignity for a little thing like public health, then you probably deserve what's coming to you."As the debate over mask-wearing rages on, one thing is clear: according to this study, if you want to avoid being labeled a big sissy, you might want to ditch the mask and toughen up. At least, that's what the experts say.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People Over". Use it as a reference: DAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - Benny Hinn is one of the best-known miraculous healers in the galaxy. His powers are formidable -- but he hasn't yet completed his training. So, Hinn got in his private jet and flew to Dagobah to complete his training in the ways of the Force with Jedi Master Yoda."Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," said Yoda."I will try," Hinn replied."Do, or do not. There is no try.""Well, I mean, I'm just going to declare victory over it," Hinn explained."That is why you fail," Yoda replied.Yoda set up various training courses in the swamps of Dagobah, from training dummies Hinn would have to try to pickpocket to a whole line of dummies he would have to knock over with his mind.In one horrible training session, Hinn went into a dark cave and was confronted by John MacArthur. "NOOOOO!!!!" Hinn screamed, running for his life after he was unable to knock MacArthur down with his Force powers.Yoda shook his head and smacked Hinn with his cane. "Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you.""Well, that all sounds pretty bad. But will I make a lot of money?""Oh, yeah, for sure," Yoda said."OK, cool," Hinn replied before pulling his private jet out of the swamp with his mind and flying back to his home planet.

candidate: Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People OverDAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - Renowned healer Benny Hinn has taken his quest for supernatural abilities to the far reaches of the galaxy. In a bid to perfect his already formidable powers of knocking people over, Hinn embarked on a journey to the swampy planet of Dagobah to seek the guidance of Jedi Master Yoda.Hinn, known for his theatrical displays of miraculous healing, was eager to unlock the full potential of his abilities. Upon arrival, he was greeted by the wise and diminutive Yoda, who wasted no time in putting Hinn through a rigorous training regimen."Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," instructed Yoda, as Hinn hesitantly attempted to channel his Force powers."I will try," Hinn replied, to which Yoda sternly retorted, "Do, or do not. There is no try."Undeterred, Hinn continued his training under Yoda's watchful eye, facing challenges that tested both his powers and his patience. From attempting to pickpocket training dummies to using his mind to knock over a line of dummies, Hinn was pushed to his limits in the swamps of Dagobah.However, it was during a particularly harrowing encounter with a shadowy figure in a dark cave that Hinn's resolve was truly tested. Confronted by the likeness of John MacArthur, Hinn's attempts to use his Force powers fell short, leading to a panicked retreat."Fear is the path to the dark side," admonished Yoda, sensing Hinn's trepidation. "Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you."Despite the ominous warning, Hinn remained focused on one burning question: "But will I make a lot of money?"To this, Yoda's response was unequivocal: "Oh, yeah, for sure."With visions of wealth and success dancing in his head, Hinn bid farewell to Dagobah, departing in his private jet with newfound determination and a pocketful of Force tricks. As the swampy planet receded from view, Hinn's journey to master the art of knocking people over had only just begun.For now, the galaxy holds its breath, waiting to see the full extent of Benny Hinn's extraordinary powers – and the lucrative ventures that lie ahead.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters". Use it as a reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - The Trump White House has added a new feature to the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room: a separate cry room for fussy reporters who are crying during press briefings and interrupting the proceedings.The quiet, serene room will allow news agencies to take their crying, wailing, fussy reporters into a separate space to calm them down so the press briefings can continue without interruption."If you notice one of your reporters starting to tear up, just take them into the cry room and soothe them before joining us again," said Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany. "There are pictures of Obama, bottles of kombucha, and some Tickle-You-Biden plushies in there to keep them occupied and help them feel safe.""Hey, wait a minute! Are you saying we're babies!?" shouted one reporter, tears welling up in his eyes."Well, yes," McEnany replied."That's... that's mean!" His lip began to quiver and he was forced to excuse himself to the cry room."WAAAAHHH!!!" cried Jim Acosta. "ORANGE MAN BAD! ORANGE MAN BAD!" One of his fellow CNN reporters cradled him in her arms and took him out into the cry room with an apologetic look on her face.The cry room may need expanding soon, however, since every single reporter except OANN's Chanel Rion was sent to the cry room during the first press briefing. Rion pointed and laughed at them as they went into the cry room, calling them "dumb babies," which made them cry harder.

candidate: **White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters**WASHINGTON, D.C. - In a move that has raised eyebrows and tissues, the Trump White House has introduced a groundbreaking new addition to the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room: a cry room designed specifically for fussy reporters.The innovative concept aims to address the increasing number of emotional outbursts and interruptions during press briefings by providing a safe space for journalists to let out their feelings without disrupting the flow of information."If a reporter feels overwhelmed or on the verge of tears, they now have a designated area to compose themselves before returning to the briefing room," explained Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany. "Our cry room comes equipped with all the essentials, including soothing images of Obama, bottles of kombucha, and plush Tickle-You-Biden toys to provide comfort."However, the introduction of the cry room has sparked mixed reactions among the press corps. One visibly emotional reporter confronted McEnany, demanding to know why they were being treated like infants."Well, yes," McEnany responded matter-of-factly. "Sometimes reporters need a little TLC, just like babies do."Amid the escalating emotions, veteran CNN reporter Jim Acosta could be heard wailing, "ORANGE MAN BAD! ORANGE MAN BAD!" before being gently escorted to the cry room by a sympathetic colleague.Despite initial resistance, the cry room quickly garnered popularity, with nearly every reporter except for OANN's Chanel Rion seeking solace within its walls. Rion, known for her unyielding demeanor, couldn't resist a playful jab at her tearful counterparts, dubbing them "dumb babies" as they shuffled past her, tissues in hand.As the White House prepares for potential expansions to accommodate the growing demand for emotional support, one thing is clear: the cry room has become the unexpected star of the briefing room, offering both a literal and metaphorical outlet for the tumultuous emotions of the press corps.In a world where words often fail, tears reign supreme – at least in the hallowed halls of the White House press briefings.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Children Threaten To Help". Use it as a reference: MAPLE BLUFFS, IA - Justin Daniels was painting the kitchen, already working hard to not drop paint on anything where paint didn't go, when a further complication was added: His five-year-old and three-year-old sons expressed a desire to help."I knew instilling in my children a desire to help others was going to come back to haunt me," Daniels told reporters. "I mean, can you imagine? It would take at least twice as long and I'd be cleaning paint off the counters for days."Daniels tried to come up with some menial tasks for the kids, such as putting painter's tape on things that didn't particularly need it, but the children insisted on helping with the core task of painting."That's when I came up with a brilliant idea," Daniels said. "I told them I was so happy that they were such good children who wanted to help that I'd reward them with a new video game. It cost me sixty bucks, but it took away any desire they had to help anyone with anything."With the children playing their new video game, Daniels was able to paint in peace, other than his kids occasionally screaming at each other.

candidate: **Children Threaten To Help: A Growing Epidemic**In a shocking turn of events, children across the nation have started to express a desire to help out with household chores, leaving parents in a state of panic and disbelief. From offering to assist with painting projects to volunteering for the dreaded task of folding laundry, children have started to show signs of altruism that are causing chaos in households everywhere.One such incident in Maple Bluffs, IA, has gained widespread attention. Justin Daniels, a father of two young boys, found himself in a precarious situation when his five-year-old and three-year-old sons expressed a desire to help him paint the kitchen. What started as a noble gesture quickly turned into a nightmare for Daniels, who feared the consequences of letting his children assist with such a task."I knew instilling in my children a desire to help others was going to come back to haunt me," Daniels lamented to reporters. "I mean, can you imagine? It would take at least twice as long and I'd be cleaning paint off the counters for days."Desperate to find a solution, Daniels tried to delegate menial tasks to his children, hoping to divert their attention from the main job at hand. However, his efforts were in vain as the children insisted on being directly involved in the painting process."That's when I came up with a brilliant idea," Daniels revealed. "I told them I was so happy that they were such good children who wanted to help that I'd reward them with a new video game. It cost me sixty bucks, but it took away any desire they had to help anyone with anything."While Daniels managed to regain control of the situation by resorting to bribery, the incident serves as a stark reminder of the growing threat of children offering to help out around the house. Parents everywhere are urged to remain vigilant and be prepared for the day when their own offspring might decide to lend a hand with chores.With children increasingly threatening to help, experts warn of potential consequences such as prolonged tasks, unexpected messes, and the loss of precious household sanity. As the epidemic of children offering assistance continues to spread, families must brace themselves for the tumultuous times ahead.In the meantime, if your child expresses a desire to help, proceed with caution and be prepared to deploy strategic tactics to maintain order in your household. Remember, a calm and collected response may be the key to surviving the chaos that ensues when children threaten to help.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Trump Replaces Washington Monument With Giant Can Of Goya Beans". Use it as a reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - Liberals have been complaining about the Washington Monument, which is named after the notorious racist George Washington. Well, Trump is now appeasing them, having taken down the century-old obelisk, replacing it with a 350-foot-tall can of Goya pinto beans.The authentic Goya can is 350 feet tall and 200 feet wide and contains 82,252,607 gallons of beans."This is the largest can of Goya beans, maybe ever," said President Trump at the dedication ceremony. "Way bigger than some of the other countries' statues and monuments. This thing makes the Eiffel Tower look laughable. I mean that literally. You look at the Eiffel Tower and you just laugh. It's not even finished. You can still see the frame. And does it have beans? Well, maybe at that snooty French restaurant. But probably not. Probably not. They just have dumb French food like cheese with funny names and bread. Admittedly the bread smells pretty good, but it doesn't live up to that when you eat it. Always smells better than it tastes. Everyone says so."Liberals tried to criticize the move but were unable to do so since they would be siding with George Washington. Plus, the optics of tearing down a monument to a Latino businessman would just be bad. "We've been played again," said Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi. "This guy really is a genius."

candidate: WASHINGTON, D.C. - In a bold and unprecedented move, President Trump has decided to replace the iconic Washington Monument with a larger-than-life symbol of America's favorite canned beans - Goya. Liberals may have thought they had Trump backed into a corner with their cries to dismantle monuments honoring the nation's controversial historical figures, but the President has once again outmaneuvered them with his latest grand gesture.The decision to erect a 350-foot-tall can of Goya pinto beans in place of the Washington Monument has left many scratching their heads, but Trump is adamant that this is a monument America can truly be proud of. "This is the largest can of Goya beans, maybe ever," Trump proudly proclaimed at the dedication ceremony. "It's bigly, it's beautiful, and it's delicious. Just like America should be."Critics have argued that replacing a symbol of the nation's first president with a giant can of beans is absurd and disrespectful. However, their attempts to condemn the move have been thwarted by the fact that they would be seen as denouncing a monument to a Latino businessman, a demographic they claim to champion. Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi reportedly exclaimed, "We've been played again. This guy really is a genius."The massive Goya can stands at 350 feet tall and 200 feet wide, containing a staggering 82,252,607 gallons of beans. Trump's decision to showcase the iconic brand has sparked both admiration and bewilderment among Americans. Some have hailed it as a symbol of diversity and inclusion, while others have simply marveled at the sheer size of the can.As the nation grapples with the implications of this unorthodox replacement, one thing is certain - the Washington Monument will forever be overshadowed by the towering presence of the Goya bean can. Love it or hate it, Trump's latest move has once again captured the attention of the nation and left everyone wondering: what will he think of next?

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Hack Suspected As Biden Posts Complete, Coherent Thought On Twitter". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Hackers have been blamed as Joe Biden posted a complete, coherent thought on Twitter earlier today.As soon as Twitter support saw that Biden had posted several complete sentences in a tweet, they immediately locked his account down, suspecting a hack."The full, rational sentences were a dead giveaway," said a Twitter IT guy. "If you're gonna pretend to be Joe Biden, you have to add in several rambling asides, some made-up words, and three or four major gaffes. It clearly wasn't him, so we took steps to lock down his account.""Hackers, you know, thhhhe--the thing that, that hacks--hackers are dangerous," said Joe Biden in a statement to the press. At this point, he abruptly fell asleep.Meanwhile, President Trump's account posted several deranged rants about random stuff, assuring everyone that his account had not been compromised.

"I mean, come on, we all know Joe Biden's tweets are usually a jumble of incoherent words and phrases. This level of clarity and logical thinking was just too suspicious to ignore."When approached for comment, Biden himself expressed his concerns about the supposed hack. "Hackers, you know, they're out there, doing the thing with the computers and such," he mumbled before trailing off into a nonsensical ramble. "Back in my day, we didn't have these hacker whippersnappers messing with our telegrams. And let me tell you about my cousin, Velma..."Meanwhile, on the other side of the political spectrum, President Trump's Twitter account remained its usual chaotic self, with a barrage of nonsensical rants and baseless accusations. Trump quickly took to Twitter to assure his followers that his account had not been compromised, adding, "My tweets may be crazy, but they're all me, folks!"As the Twitterverse grapples with the fallout of this bewildering incident, one thing remains clear - in the realm of social media, coherence is often the surest sign of foul play.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "More People Voluntarily Committing Themselves To Asylums To Escape Insanity Of Real World". Use it as a reference: U.S. - More people are voluntarily committing themselves to mental institutions in an attempt to escape the ever-increasing insanity of the real world.Thousands of people have checked themselves in at psychiatric wards across the country, claiming to be insane, in order to get away from the absolute insanity of everything that's happening outside."Oh yeah, I'm totally crazy, 100%," said Frank Zwygart as he checked himself in to an asylum in Arkham. "I think I'm Napoleon Bonaparte or whatever. Yep, totally insane.""That guy over there swinging the golf club at the orderly thinks we're living in a simulation, while Bob over in the corner thinks he's God," said recently committed man Frank Zwygart. "So yeah, it's a little less crazy than things out there. We don't worry about stuff like Kanye running for president, murder hornets, nunchuck bears, bubonic squirrels, World War 3, or getting doxxed for old tweets. And they've got lots of great board games in here.""Plus, Bob's actually a pretty cool guy once you get to know him," he added as he adjusted his straitjacket. "Actually, he's totally sane -- his beliefs make perfect sense to him. There's an internal logic to everything he believes, unlike some of the crazies you try to talk to out there in the crazy world."

candidate: Headline: More People Voluntarily Committing Themselves To Asylums To Escape Insanity Of Real WorldIn a bizarre turn of events, it seems that the real world has become so ludicrous that people are willingly seeking refuge in mental institutions to escape its mind-boggling insanity. The current state of affairs outside the asylum walls has driven many individuals to feign madness and admit themselves to psychiatric wards across the country."I mean, who wouldn't want to escape from the absolute circus that is the real world right now?" remarked a newly admitted patient, who insisted on being called Napoleon Bonaparte during his stay. "I'd much rather be in here discussing my delusions of grandeur with fellow patients than out there dealing with Kanye West's presidential aspirations and the threat of murder hornets."Reports from inside the asylums reveal a surreal environment where patients believe they are living in a simulation, think they are deities, or engage in activities like playing golf with orderlies. One inmate even claimed, "It's a little less crazy in here than it is out there. At least we don't have to worry about nunchuck-wielding bears or bubonic squirrels plotting World War 3."Despite the seemingly eccentric nature of their beliefs, inmates find solace in the fact that the internal logic of their delusions provides a sense of stability that is sorely lacking in the real world. "Sure, Bob may think he's God, but at least he's consistent in his beliefs," one patient pointed out while readjusting his straitjacket. "Out there, people are changing their minds faster than you can say 'fake news.'"As more and more individuals seek asylum from the madness of everyday life, it raises the question: Are we truly living in a world that is crazier than the confines of a mental institution? Or have we all collectively lost our grip on reality in a desperate attempt to cope with the chaos around us? One thing is for certain - the line between sanity and insanity has never been blurrier.
